definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: This book has a curved spine, French style.
sentences.chinese: 我的这本书书脊是弯曲的，法国风。

sentences.english: There’s even a blue nylon bookmark glued into the spine.
sentences.chinese: 书脊处甚至粘着尼龙书签绳。

sentences.english: Crimp spine on pages for permanent binding.
The ribbon should wrap around the spine with excess on either side.
sentences.chinese: 带子要绕在书脊上，两边都要留空。

sentences.english: I don't have photos but these are the stages of where you lay glue.
sentences.chinese: 你需要的是墙纸用胶水和刚才粘书脊的胶水。

sentences.english: Open the book so that the first and last pages and the core of the spine are facing up.
sentences.chinese: 将书打开，封面封底和书脊朝上。

sentences.english: Starched reinforced fabric used to strengthen a book binding or the spine of a bound book .
sentences.chinese: 用于加固书本封皮或合订本书脊的浆硬加厚织布。

sentences.english: Maybe it’s analogous to a book’s spine.
sentences.chinese: 它可能就相当于一本书的书脊吧。

sentences.english: It will help to secure the paper block to the cover and reenforce the spine. Yay!
sentences.chinese: 这将保证书与书脊能够充分地贴合。

sentences.english: First we need the manilla cardboard for the spine of the cover.
sentences.chinese: 首先我们要用到档案袋的牛皮纸来做书脊部分的封面。

sentences.english: A volume of Roman myths dangled from his hand, its spine broken.
sentences.chinese: 一本罗马神话甩在手中，书脊已经散开了。

definition: dust jacket (of a book)/protective cover/document seal
the back cover of a book
binding and layout (of a book etc)
